trans-unit.source: Using the Facebook Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the Facebook Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the Facebook Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the Facebook Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Get started with the Facebook Connector and add it to your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Get started with the Facebook Connector and add it to your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Connect to Facebook account to post a message or publish a photo.
trans-unit.target: Connect to Facebook account to post a message or publish a photo.

trans-unit.source: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.
trans-unit.target: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.

trans-unit.source: With the Facebook Connector, you can:
trans-unit.target: With the Facebook Connector, you can:

trans-unit.source: Use triggers to retrieve “New Post on User Timeline” or “New Post on Page”.
trans-unit.target: Use triggers to retrieve “New Post on User Timeline” or “New Post on Page”.

trans-unit.source: When a new post is retrieved, it triggers a new instance of the flow and passes the data received in the request to the flow for processing.
trans-unit.target: When a new post is retrieved, it triggers a new instance of the flow and passes the data received in the request to the flow for processing.

trans-unit.source: Use actions that let you “Publish Post”, “Publish Photo”, and so on.
trans-unit.target: Use actions that let you “Publish Post”, “Publish Photo”, and so on.

trans-unit.source: These actions gets back a response and makes it available for the actions in the flow to consume.
trans-unit.target: These actions gets back a response and makes it available for the actions in the flow to consume.

trans-unit.source: You can add the Facebook Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: You can add the Facebook Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: Triggers and Actions
trans-unit.target: Triggers and Actions

trans-unit.source: Triggers
trans-unit.target: Triggers

trans-unit.source: Actions
trans-unit.target: Actions

trans-unit.source: New Post on User Timeline
trans-unit.target: New Post on User Timeline

trans-unit.source: New Post on Page
trans-unit.target: New Post on Page

trans-unit.source: Publish Post
trans-unit.target: Publish Post

trans-unit.source: Publish Photo
trans-unit.target: Publish Photo

trans-unit.source: Create the Facebook connector for your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Create the Facebook connector for your Logic App

trans-unit.source: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: To create a connector from the Marketplace:
trans-unit.target: To create a connector from the Marketplace:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure startboard, select **Marketplace**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure startboard, select **Marketplace**.

trans-unit.source: Search for “Facebook Connector”, select it, and select **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Search for “Facebook Connector”, select it, and select **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties:
trans-unit.target: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties:

trans-unit.source: Select **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Using the Facebook Connector in your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Using the Facebook Connector in your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Once your API app is created, you can now use the Facebook connector as a trigger/action for your Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Once your API app is created, you can now use the Facebook connector as a trigger/action for your Logic App.

trans-unit.source: To do this, you need to:
trans-unit.target: To do this, you need to:

trans-unit.source: In your logic app, open **Triggers and Actions** to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your flow:
trans-unit.target: In your logic app, open **Triggers and Actions** to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your flow:

trans-unit.source: The Facebook connector is listed in the gallery:
trans-unit.target: The Facebook connector is listed in the gallery:

trans-unit.source: Select the Facebook connector to automatically add in the designer.
trans-unit.target: Select the Facebook connector to automatically add in the designer.

trans-unit.source: Select **Authorize**, enter your credentials, and select **Allow**:
trans-unit.target: Select **Authorize**, enter your credentials, and select **Allow**:

trans-unit.source: Select a trigger:
trans-unit.target: Select a trigger:

trans-unit.source: You can now use the Posts retrieved from the Facebook trigger in other actions.
trans-unit.target: You can now use the Posts retrieved from the Facebook trigger in other actions.

trans-unit.source: In the below flow, whenever a new post has been posted on User’s Facebook timeline, the same post will be Tweeted in User’s Twitter Timeline:
trans-unit.target: In the below flow, whenever a new post has been posted on User’s Facebook timeline, the same post will be Tweeted in User’s Twitter Timeline:

trans-unit.source: In the similar way you can create flows by using Facebook connector actions.
trans-unit.target: In the similar way you can create flows by using Facebook connector actions.

trans-unit.source: The below flow will retrieve new message posted on Yammer group and publish the same post on Facebook page managed by User:
trans-unit.target: The below flow will retrieve new message posted on Yammer group and publish the same post on Facebook page managed by User:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] To get Facebook Page ID or Yammer Group ID, look for the numeric code in the URL.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] To get Facebook Page ID or Yammer Group ID, look for the numeric code in the URL.

trans-unit.source: Do more with your Connector
trans-unit.target: Do more with your Connector

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).

trans-unit.target: test
